Preface
Mankind is considered to be the highest and most advanced form of creation of God, Almighty, over and above all creations of the Universe. The reason behind this is the fact that human beings, unlike any other form of life on earth, have been gifted with a unique quality of comprehension and thinking, thereby making them superior to all other living creatures. We all know that life goes around in a cycle of birth and death, one day the body has to demolish so as to allow the soul (Atma) to unite with God, the (Parmatma) According to age old beliefs, life as a human being is sacred and is attained only by a handful. Our good deeds and actions, called karmas, determine our form of birth but the quality of life that we lead on earth is determined and chosen by us through our inclination towards it. Everyone wants to live in peace and tranquility, earn in bountiful and lead a lavish life but how many of us are able to fulfill our so called dreams? Dr. Puneet Chawla, in this book, throws light on how, by synchronizing the essential elements of Vaastu in correlation with nature, can make life worth living for an individual. Vaastu Shastra is an age-old doctrine which enables us to improvise our quality and standard of living through synchronization of positive energies and vibrations present in the universe, in and around us. According to him, a well-formulated and balanced

equity with the five elements of nature viz water, air, earth, space and fire, can bring about a drastic change in harmonizing and creating a stress-free, comfortable and peaceful environment for us to live in.
This book is a handy and quick guide which educates the readers as to how, by following simple steps in their day-to-day living, they can transform their unsuccessful and troublesome lives into a happy and prosperous one.

What is Vaastu?
The desires and needs of man are increasing in multifold. With the advent of every new generation, newer set of aspirations and a zeal for a higher and more qualitative livelihood is ever increasing, making survival difficult for people from all walks of life. What we sow, so we reap, and hence if we want a flourishing and flowering garden of success around us, we need to inculcate and adhere to the principles of Vaastu righteously. For this we need to know what exactly we mean by Vaastu.
Vaastu Shastra, as the name implies, is an age-old, ancient science based on Hindu Puranas and Upanishads which determine the architecture and designing of a structure, commercial or residential, well synchronized and balanced with the five elements of nature in alignment with the ten major directions, as demonstrated by the earth’s axis. It is believed that Lord Rama, while living in the forest when he was in exile, built a cottage in Panchawati following all the norms of Vaastu and after conducting a ‘Vaastu Shanti Sanskar’ or puja for the same. Hence, he was able to win over all his enemies, thereby freeing mankind from the evil clutches of Ravana, the Lord of demons.  This automatically proves how old this doctrine of Vaastu dates back to and how it leads to good and bad destiny that follows for an individual. We all know that Earth is round and whatever is released into

the universal space goes in a round circle and comes back to us. Hence, it is highly essential that the environment around us creates positive vibrations for us, which, when comes back in rotation, brings in happiness, prosperity and success. If our surround


dings generate negative energies, what we get in return is also negative and unfavorable both for our health as well as wealth conditions. It is here that Vaastu plays a pivotal role in creating and reflecting positive energies in and around our surroundings so that we get back only positive results in life. Man can never win over nature; hence it is best to create a friendly relationship between the two to ensure harmonious living.

VAASTU PURUSH


The Origin of Vaastu Purush
As per Hindu scriptures, in a close encounter with the demon Andhakasur, Lord Shiva perspired profusely and out of the droplets of his sweat, the Vaastu Purush came into being. He pleased Lord Shiva and got himself his blessings to defeat and rule over the three worlds, viz the terrestrial, celestial and the demon world. Pride overpowered him and he started to devour everything that came in his way. All the deities, headed by Lord Indra, arrested the Vaastu Purush and threw him into a square pit dug on the earth’s surface with his face down, head in northeast and feet in southwest direction respectively. This marked the origi

n of the Vaastu Purush who was christened the “spirit of the Building” since then. By nature, it is believed that if the Vaastu Purush of a given plot is left hungry and unattended, he would go to the extent to ruin its owners. So, in order to appease him, plot owners should perform special ceremonies and rituals right from the time of acquiring a piece of land or plot. Also, while getting construction done on the plot, it should be deeply noted not to hurt or twist the delicate parts of the Vaastu Purush’s body or else it would bring about devastation for its possessor.


The different body parts of the Vaastu Purush
As quoted in the Maya Mattam, the Vaastu Purush has six bones, four vessels, four vulnerable points and a single ruling heart. Special care should be taken to keep these key portions of his body free from any kind of defect by the architect while undergoing construction or else the Vaastu Purush would ruin its proprietor.


Measurement of the body parts of the Vaastu Purush
When laid on the ground, the Vaastu Purush is measured in the form of squares. These measurements begin from the cardinal directions, i.e. from East to West and from North to South. As mentioned in the Britha Samhita, 45 deities occupy his body. The square map of his body is made in two forms consisting of 64 and 81 squares respectively. VAASTU MANDALA
The configuration of the Vaastu Purush, in its fundamental form, which enables the creation of architectural as well as other shapes and sizes, is what have been termed as the Vaastu Purush Mandala. The Mandala is denoted in a square grid form which in turn has been oriented to the four cardinal directions. Through these square grids, energy networks are expressed graphically where 32 dieties are believed to reside mainly in the four corners or directions viz; north, east, south and west. Each of these four directions has been further divided into nine parts respectively which in turn is ruled by its presiding deity.
According to the Matsya Purana, these square forms should sum up to a total of 81 parts which should be exactly equal in size to one another. All the 45 deities, mentioned above, reside in these 81 square grids ou

t of which 32 hold positions in the outer square boundaries while the remaining 13 constitute the inner squares of the grid. Each of these deities has their respective positive and negative attributes which have to be carefully and closely synchronized and balanced with the building plan layout, the entrance doors and so on. Let us see how the positions of these deities should be distributed over any given structure in accordance with the four main directions.
EAST
* Lord Shikhi holds the first place and hence it is not advisable to make the main entrance here as it would bring about sorrow, loss and fear from fire. 
* Lord Parjanya occupies the second place and there should never be a door here as it would bring about grief and poverty for its occupants.
* Lord Jayant masters the third place which should be done with doors as this would bring loads of money.
* Lord Indra commands the fourth place and hence the main entrance should be made here which would ensure both respect and fame.
* Lord Surya rules the fifth place which should be adorned with a door as it would entitle the owner with power and money.
* Lord Satya is the holder of the sixth place and a door in this position would mean loss and theft of valuables.
* Lord Brish holds the seventh place and a door here would lead to creation of anger and cruelty.
* Lord Antariksha occupies the eighth place and a door

over here would welcome theft and loss from fire.
SOUTH
* Lord Anil occupies the ninth place and a door in this place would mean generation of health issues for the residents.
* Lord Pusha holds the tenth place and a door in this position would bring about bad reputation for the occupant.
* Lord Vitahth rules the eleventh place and a door here indicates fear and depression.
* Lord Brithttakst dominates the twelfth place ensures blessing the occupants with children and prosperity.
* Lord Yama empowers the thirteenth place and a door in this position provides monetary benefits.
* Lord Gandharva occupies the fourteenth place and a door here makes the residents free from all kinds of fears and inhibitions. 
* Lord Bringraj masters the fifteenth place and a door in this lace causes poverty and diseases.
* Lord Mrig is the holder of the sixteenth place and a door here is a symbol of poverty and ill health.
WEST
* Lord Pita controls the seventeenth place and a placing a door in this position invites poverty and enemies.
* Lord Dowairk holds the eighteenth place and a door here would bring umpteen problems, both mental and physical, for the women folk of the family.
* Lord Sugriva caters to the nineteenth position and a door here would ensure wealth and prosperity for the owner.
* Lord Pushpadant occupies the twentieth place and a door here entitles the occupants overall

success including name, fame and good health.
* Lord Varundev controls the twenty-first place and a door here brings about money as well as good luck.
* Lord Asur is the holder of the twenty-second place and a door in this place brings in ill luck.
* Lord Shosh occupies the twenty-third place and huge losses would be incurred if a door is placed in this position.
* Lord Papyashama is the owner of the twenty-fourth place and a door in this place would bring along grief and diseases for the occupants.
NORTH
* Lord Rog occupies the twenty-fifth place and a door here would only bring about misfortunes, poverty and death sentences for its soul-mates.
* Lord Nag owns the twenty-sixth place and a door here would indicate creation of many enemies, disrespect and bad luck.
* Lord Mukhya holds the twenty-seventh place and heavy losses would be incurred if a door happens to be here.
* Lord Bhallat rules the twenty-eighth position and a door at this point would shower the owner with money and abundance, bringing about overall prosperity.
* Lord Som is the controller of the twenty-ninth place and a door in this place bestows the owner with obedient children, money in abundance and unmatched prosperity. 
* Lord Bhujang occupies the thirtieth place and a door in this region would establish disharmony and quarrels among the inmates of the structure.
*  Lord Aditi holds the thirty-f

irst place and a door here would bring about lots of obstructions in the path of success for its owners.
* Lord Diti is the bearer of the thirty-second place and a door here would bring about diseases and obstacles both from physical as well as materialistic point of view.
IMPORTANCE OF DIRECTIONS IN VAASTU
Directions play a pivotal role in determining the Vaastu of a place. Just as a car has to synchronize and balance completely with its four wheels in order to have a smooth ride so does the science of Vaastu need to strike the correct cord with the four major directions viz; north, south, east and west. While constructing a house, it should be strictly kept in mind to study the directions properly in accordance with the Vaastu of that place.
There are ten directions in total. Apart from the four major directions, there are six more directions which affect and influence the Vaastu of a property or place. They are as follows:
* North-east (Ishan) Between the North and the East
* South-east (Agneya) Between the South and the East
* South-west (Nirutya) Between the South and West
* North-west (Vayaya) Between the North and the west
* Space (Udharva)
* Centre
The present era has made it convenient to measure and determine the directions quite conveniently by inventing the magnetic compass, unlike olden days when people used to observe the shadow of the sun to check the

directions of a place. However, a compass can verify only eight directions out of ten. It covers a total of 360 degrees with its radius out of which 45 degrees have been allotted to each of the directions. It is highly essential to check the level of degree within each direction while ascertaining the Vaastu of a structure or property. 
Let us now consider the different directions minutely, along with their attributes:
NORTH
The North direction is considered as one of the most auspicious directions in Vaastu, the reason being that it is owned by Lord Kuber, the giver of Wealth and Prospertiy. Hence, this direction is also referred to as the wealth and career direction. It is ruled by the planet Budh (Mercury)
1. The north direction occupies the chest of the Vaastu Purush and therefore this portion of the house or structure should be kept free from any kind of clutters. There should be lots of light and open space around this area. 
2. Being near to the North Pole, the north direction is believed to receive a lot of positive energy from there which in turn is considered quite beneficial for its residents. Hence, there should be large openings in the Northern portion of a property so as to allow easy inflow of positive vibrations directly from the North Pole.
3. The North direction, being a highly positive side of any given structure, should be used very carefully. It shoul

d be ensured that there are no bathrooms in this portion of the house as it would lead to incurring heavy looses. Also, a storeroom in this direction can account to stagnation of income flow and a block in finances. More so, a master bedroom in this area can aggravate restlessness and a kitchen here would burn up all the positive energies entitled to this direction, leading the family to heavy losses and debt. 
4. If an underground water tank or presence of slopes happens to be in the north direction, it would result in boosting the family income and hence improvising their financial status.
5. A mirror is believed to reflect whatever comes its way and hence mirrors on the northern wall can double the positive energies of this direction.
6. One should avoid building closets on the northern wall as it blocks the energy from flowing inside the premises freely.
7. The number of openings, doors and windows, in the North should always be more in quantity and size in order to avoid generation of expenditure-related issues.
8. North facing buildings or properties should have a lower elevation in the front space as compared to the rest of the sides in order to avoid Vaastu defects.
SOUTH
There are great misconceptions in the minds of people regarding this direction. The South has always been considered as a problematic direction in terms of Vaastu but actually it is not true. Ru

led by the planet Mangal (Mars), the south is, truly speaking, the storehouse for the energies that emanate from the north and hence there should be no openings in this area. Owned by Lord Yama, the God of death, this direction determines legal affairs, financial prospects and even health factors for the occupants of the related structure.
1. The south portion of a house should mostly be covered and devoid of any large openings so as to ensure no leakage of the positive energies coming from the North direction. 
2. A store in the south is considered a good idea as this direction needs to be blocked, especially for people living in a joint family. Placing lots of furniture and closets can also prove beneficial in stabilizing the energies in this area.
3.   Builders should make thick walls in the south direction in order to nullify the evil effects of Yama.
4. Mirrors or clocks should not be hung on the south walls as this may prove unfavorable for its inmates. Instead, pictures of sky-rocketing buildings and mountains should be pasted in this section of the house to make it more supportive and fruitful.
5. Red color hues are highly recommended on the south walls. Painting the walls red or decorating the region with red flowers and curtains can be very useful.
6. The younger members of the family or the children folk should occupy the southern bedrooms of the house.
7. The

re should not be any bore wells in the south as this may lead to heavy financial losses and even death of near and dear ones.
EAST
Again a very powerful direction, the East is owned by Lord Indra, the bestower of happiness, prosperity, Power and prestige. The planet Surya (Sun) rules this direction that alone is responsible for supporting life and vegetation on Earth. Hence, the East direction is also referred to as the Direction of Growth. Sun has always been regarded as the purifier, cleanser and energizer of the entire universe and therefore the East symbolizes prosperity and fulfillment in one’s life.
1. The Eastern side, just like the Northern side, should be well-ventilated, open and absolutely clean. There should not be obstacles and blockages in this direction as it brings in lots of solar energy that contain therapeutic properties, capable of healing up various negativities and ailments. Even the upholstery used for this direction should be light in shade as well as in terms of fabric used.
2. The East direction should never have a staircase, bathroom or store room. Where a staircase can lead to heart-related problems, a bathroom or store here can block the flow of positive energies to the western side of the house. This may lead to restriction of growth and success of the residents.
3. The front courtyard of an East-facing plot should always be kept open and with

lots of open space. Also, the back of such a plot should always be made of concrete flooring so that there is no scope for restriction of financial growth.
4. The East is should always be attributed to the deities and hence a puja room in this direction is highly advisable. Even a study room or a conference room is considered good. 
5. It is recommended to face the eastern direction while working or watching television.
6. Eastern rooms can have a lower level of flooring as it is a sign of happiness and prosperity for the family.




WEST
The genitals, lower abdomen and the reproductive organs of the Vaastu Purush are believed to be located in the west direction. Lord Varun, the God of water, rain and fame is its occupant and the ruling planet is Shani (Saturn) This direction brings stability in life. The unique quality of the west is that it comes in form at night, after sunset.
1. We are all aware of the fact that the sun rises in the East and sets in the West. The energy that is generated on sunrise travels through the day and gets settled in the west direction at night, post sunset. Hence, there should not be large openings in the west portion of a house so as to avoid the subtle energies from flowing out of the premises. If this happens, the prospect of income to the residents is lost. It should therefore be kept in mind to make stronger and mightier walls in th

e west.
2.  The western portion of the house can be occupied by children or guests or it may also be used as restrooms or family sit-out areas. But, it should in no circumstances be made a couple’s bedroom as it would lead to transfer of one of the spouses, making it difficult for them to live together.
3. Kitchen in the west should be avoided too as it would lead to excessive expenditures and creation of instability in income sources.
4. A Puja room in the West is also a blunder to make as it would ignite selfishness and rude behavior among the family members.
5.  To avoid health problems from encircling around the men folk of the family, the west should never be used for rain-water harvesting, underground water tanks, swimming pools and borings or for making water slopes.
6. The west is best suited for placing overhead water tanks as the owner of this direction is Lord Varun, the God of water.
7. The western side of a plot should always be heavier from the eastern side and to do this, one can plant lot of trees on the exterior. To occupy the vacant space within the house, one can place lots of heavy furniture in this portion.
8. Plots with gardens or open spaces facing the West side should not be opted for.
9. The main entrance for the house should never be in the West as this would bring in misfortune for its occupants.
10. The western walls should be adorned with f

amily pictures and photographs. Mirrors should be avoided.
11. The western portion of the house should not have extensions as this would create delays in life.
12. The west, as mentioned above, is a night-friendly direction and hence dark shades like violet and grey should be used to adorn this area.
NORTH-EAST
As per Hindu mythology and Vaastu doctrines, the North-east is occupied by the supreme deity, Lord Shiva and the ruling planet is Brihaspati (Jupiter) who bestows knowledge and spiritual growth to its worshippers. This direction produces a very strong and influential axis of magnetic energy which traverses through to the south-west.  The implication is, if this direction is used properly, one can enjoy its benefits in multifold over a large span of time. This direction is therefore considered to be highly sensitive as well as pious which is capable of providing extreme benefits to an individual in all spheres of life, including health, wealth and overall prosperity. 
1. The North-east of the house should be kept open and vacant as far as possible so as to allow free flow of the energy that gets originated here. There should not be a bedroom, store or washroom which would hold heavy furniture in this area.
2.  The North-east is considered the face of the house as the face of the Vaastu Purush lies in this direction. Hence it should be kept spic and span, free from d

irt. 
3. North-east is best suited for a Puja-room as this is the most pious corner of the house, occupied by Lord Shiva himself.
4. Even a study room in this portion f the house is highly recommended, the reason being that this direction symbolizes wisdom and learning. The powerful energies created here assist in increasing the concentration and memorizing power of students and scholars. 
5. The main entrance of a house in the North-east is also considered very auspicious.
6. The North-east should never have a toilet as this would invite health problems for its residents. Also, placing garbage in this area would lead to heavy losses at the business front.
7. Where an underground water tank can be placed here, it’s a serious Vaastu offence to place a generator, transformer or an overhead water tank in the North-east of a plot. Even a stair-case might prove to be disastrous here.
8. The North-east belongs to the Water element and hence having a kitchen or a fire-place in this area can lead to major accidents. It can even result in causing health problems and clashes among the family members.
9. A room in the North-east should never be occupied by couples as this may result in serious health problems for both of them. Also, chances of not conceiving or having a miscarriage or giving birth to a mentally challenged child are high here.  
10. The North-east should be devoid

of any elevated platforms as this may suppress the magnetic energies generated here, thereby hindering its inflow into the house.
11. Natural pits present in this direction are considered very auspicious. Being dominated by the water element, a slope leading to the northeast corner indicates prosperity and well being for its inmates.
NORTH-WEST
The North-west direction is owned by Vayudev, the Lord Wind and hence this direction is a propeller for great opportunities relating to career and success of an individual, if used in the right manner. Contrarily, if not abided by Vaastu principles, this direction can put one’s career and future prospects to the doldrums and ruin everything. The ruling planet of this direction is Chand (moon). The wrong usage of the North-west corner can bring about instability, cause diseases and create restlessness for the residents of the building.
1. The nature of wind is to keep moving or flowing and hence the North-west corner of a house is best suited for a guest room or a drawing room where people would come for some time and leave. Also, a finished goods store in this direction is an excellent idea as it would quick movement of the end products and no delays in receiving payments.
2. A bedroom or a study room in this area would bring about instability in income, lack of concentration and loss of memory and hence should be avoided.
3. Admin

istrative and legal problems arise if the North-west of any house is kept cluttered or blocked especially with metallic items or junk.
4. There should not be any elevated floor in this section as it would cause problems in the higher education of children.
5. A bedroom in this section should never be given to a married son as it would lead to his moving away from the house.
SOUTH-EAST
The South-east direction is owned by Agni, the Lord of fire. The sun, as we all know, is the harshest when it reaches this direction and hence this area of a house is always attributed to fire-related devices. The ruling planet is Shukra (Venus) Being a highly sensitive direction, great care should be taken while handling this section, especially while striking a balance with the opponents of Fire viz. the element of Water and Air.
1. A kitchen in the south-east is a wonderful idea as this direction is owned by the Agnidev. All food cooked here is believed to be blessed by the deity and hence is supposed to bring about health and prosperity for it members.
2. A bedroom in this direction can prove to be disastrous as it may cause serious behavioral problems for its occupants. The ultra-violet rays of the sun get accumulated in this direction throughout the day thereby causing strained marital relations, even leading to divorce in many cases.
3. Problems relating to electricity and electronic

equipments would be given an open invitation if an overhead water tank is placed in this portion of the house. Similar is the case with underground water tanks as it would cause unrest and clashes among the family members, friends and relatives. It may even give rise to legal and administrative issues.
4. Fire-related accidents are expected if there happens to be a water slope or a swimming pool heading towards the south-east of a plot. Fire and water being contrasting elements cannot be placed on a common platform ever.
5. One should never make a Puja room, study room or store important files and valuables in this corner of the house. The heated up environment of this direction would destroy everything stored here.
6. The main entrance of a house should never be in the South-east as it would create legal problems for its occupants.
7. Losses in business organizations are incurred if a mirror is placed on the south-east walls of a house.
SOUTH-WEST
The South-west direction is owned by a demon called Niriti while the ruling planet is Rahu. The magnetic energies flowing in from the North-east are stored in this direction and hence it is considered to be the strongest point of a plot. This direction, if used favorably, can ensure health, wealth, confidence, name and fame for its residents. Contrastingly, it can bring about major losses, cause depression, anxiety and suicida

l feelings and even invite problems at the workplace, if used against the Vaastu principles.
1. The South-west is the best location for a master bedroom as it consists of dominating overtones. It would ensure happiness in terms of health as well as wealth for the head of the family but if this part f the house is occupies by the son of the family, it would lead to major clashes among the family members, especially the mother-in-law and the daughter-in-law.
2. The cash drawer of a business unit or shop should always be placed in the south-west as it keeps cash stable and secure for a long period. Women of the house should keep their valuables in this part of the premises as it would ensure safety as well as security.
3. The entrance of a house should never fall in the South-west as it would lead to major mishaps in the life of its inmates. 
4. An underground water tank in the south-east would mean causing delays in the life of its owners, right from personal matters to decisions relating to business and financial deals.
5. A basement in the south-west should be avoided at all costs as it would create depression and anxiety for the occupants.
6. The south-west portion of the house should be more elevated. It should also be heavier from the rest of the structure. 
7. The reputations and fame of the family members of the house are put at stake of a kitchen is built in this d

irection.
8. It should be noted that there are no cracks on the south-western walls of the house as it would cause major health problems for its residents and incurring of added expenditures for the treatment of the same.
THE FIVE ELEMENTS AND SUBTLE ENERGIES
We are surrounded by positive as well as negative energies. Our body is comprised of Five Elements, also known as the Panch Mahabhoot Tatvas, namely Fire, Water, Air, Space and Earth. The energies surrounding us, present in our environment, needs to be harmonized with the five elements of nature present both within and outside our body so as to make life worth living. In a nutshell, we can enjoy the benefits of a healthy mind, body and soul in a peaceful environment only when we strike a balance with nature and its properties.
Each of the five elements of Nature have been assigned and attributed with some special powers. It is highly essential to recognize these powers and capitalize on them to extract maximum benefit out of them. 
Space emits the power of sound, Air enhances the power of touch, Earth provides shape and structure to the human body, Water fulfills the requirement of the essential fluids while Fire ignites hunger and heat in the body. Let us now see how these factors affect the Vaastu of a place and also the overall growth of an individual.




THE ELEMENT OF EARTH
Tilted at a degree of about 23 ½

degrees at the meridian, the Earth takes a full one year, 365 ¼ days, to revolve once round the sun and a span of 24 hours to spin from the West to the East on its own axis. While revolution of earth around the sun causes the change in seasons, rotation of earth on its axis causes the transformation of days into nights. Only ¼ th of Earth consists of solid land, the rest 3/4th of its surface is full of water. There is a gravitational force and a magnetic energy field which affects every animate and inanimate object present on the Earth’s surface. Hence any solid structure or plot is influenced by the Earth element and it’s gravitational as well as magnetic forces. This 1/4th part of every plot is dominated and controlled equally by the south and the west directions. Intense care should be taken to ensure that these two directions of every plot have been harnessed by the Earth element. As per Vaastu principles, there should not be a basement, a well or an underground water tank in the south-west. Also, these directions should not be left vacant either. The best option is to create a heavy structure or elevation towards the South-west so as to make the plot high-yielding and prosperous for its inmates.   
THE ELEMENT OF SPACE
Space consists of the entire universe and the solar system including the whole galaxy. It is infinite and is hence called Ananth. We get the sound energy

from this element of nature which in turn gets empowered by forces like heat, gravitational forces, waves of the sea, magnetic field and others. 
Being the originator of the power of sound, the Space occupies the center of every plot. Also known as the Brahmasthala, this portion or area of every property plays a pivotal role in ascertaining the growth, expansion and prosperity of its residents.  As per Vaastu doctrines, there should be open space at the center of every plot. This helps in the creation of a synergy in accordance with the rest of the four elements which in turn reflects positive vibrations in and around the adjoining surroundings, thereby bringing about happiness and success for its inmates.
THE ELEMENT OF AIR
The element of air is highly essential to keep life going on Earth. It is the most important feature required for survival of every living thing. Considered to be a life-giving factor, Air comprises of various gases, the proportion of which varies in terms of percentage. It is a mixture of 21% Oxygen, 78% Nitrogen and 1% consisting of carbon-di-oxide, dust particles, humidity and water-vapor. All forms of life need air to breathe and hence air is also referred to as Praan Vaayu.
According to Vaastu principles, Air should flow in a zigzag path within a house. It should not come in and flow out immediately, in fact, it should circulate well within the pr

emises and reach out to each and every nook and corner of the interior space. That is why, it is not advisable to place the front and rear doors facing each other in any given room. Moreover, we should avoid keeping too many decorative pieces within the moving space of a house as this would create congestion and would not allow the positive energies coming in from the various directions to flow freely within the structure.
The nature of air determines instability and movement. The actual place of Air, as per Vaastu, is the North-west corner of a plot. Hence, this corner should never be occupied by the entrepreneurs, employees and workers of a business organization. In case of homes, the north-west room should always be occupied by girls of marriageable age as this would expedite marriage on the cards. This corner should also be kept unblocked and uncluttered.
THE ELEMENT OF FIRE
 Fire is a symbol of both light and heat. Heat emitted in every form in the solar system including plutonic heat, heat from volcanic eruptions, energy in the form of lightning, heat of fever and inflammation, energy emitted through the change of days into nights and vice-versa and so on. 
Fire is also a symbol of life. It transforms raw grains into cooked food, thereby altering their present form completely and granting them with a totally new face. Such is the capacity of fire that it can melt down

one of the hardest metals kike iron and shape it into narrow wires, spirals, sheets and so on. Gold, too, cannot be given its pure and polished form without being subjected to fire. 
As for the human body, fire is a generator of heat, hunger and thrust. To get maximum benefit from this element of nature, the temperature of a room should always be kept moderate, neither too hot nor too cold, as this hampers the functioning and thinking capacity of the human mind. 
Agni dominates the South-east direction of a plot; hence the kitchen should always be located in this part of the house. Energy in the form of infra red rays emitted from the sun get stored in the South-east direction and if a couple happens to occupy a room in this location, there is sure to be disturbance in their marital life. 
We all know that fire and water are anti each other and can never stay in one place. Hence, intense care should be taken to make sure there are no bore wells, swimming pools or water tanks in this part of the structure. If this is not given importance and gets overlooked, it would bring about unforeseen mishaps, unnecessary tensions, litigations, breakdown of machineries and so on within the premises for its residents.
THE ELELMENT OF WATER  
Water exists in its plutonic and natural form as a combination of hydrogen and oxygen in the ration 2:1. Being one of the most fundamental element

s required for the growth of life on earth, water exists in three forms, viz; solid (ice), liquid (water) and gas (water vapor). Without water, our body would stop functioning as it supports all juices, fluids and even blood within our system. Hence, it is highly essential to keep a structure well supplied with water. This ensures a good inflow of funds for its inmates. 
Lord Varundev is the presiding deity of Water who occupies the north-east portion or the northern corner of any given plot or property. A Kalash full of Gangajal kept in this direction of the house bring in auspicious and positive vibes. Also, all bore wells, water tanks and swimming pools should be located in this portion of a property. It is also believed in Vaastu that facing the north while drinking water brings in abundant wealth. Even mirrors hung on the northern walls invite prosperity for the family. A very important point to be noted, however, is to check for any kind of leakage from taps or other water bodies within the house as this would symbolize wastage of money or money being flown out in some other form.
SUBTLE ENERGIES
Subtle energies can be explained as the deeper and denser forms of electromagnetic energy and matter that constitute our physical world. In other words, they are higher levels of radiations which cannot be detected by the standard physics instrumentations. These include energy

from the North Pole, electromagnetic energy, the gravitational energy of the earth and the solar energy. These energies are so fine that they cannot be seen with the naked eye; instead they can only be sensed or felt. 
Subtle energies are Omni-present. They flow in a circular movement within the channels and chakras and keep moving within the environment. Being a vital energy form, they distribute energy throughout the subtle body. These delicate energies flow freely through the chakras when the body is well balanced and the person is physically strong and healthy. On the contrary, if these energies are blocked due to any reason, they cause physical, mental as well as emotional diseases within the human body.
Similarly, if these energies, which are also called life-force energies, are not permitted to flow freely within a building structure due to its wrong Vaastu placements, the structure gets obstructed, thereby causing various problems for the inmates of the house or building.
Hence, while constructing any building, intense care should be taken to make sure that all these subtle energies are given a free-flowing path to let positive vibrations float fearlessly within the given structure or premises. 


SYMBOLS OF VAASTU
It is a very common practice in almost every Hindu home to decorate their house with sacred as well as art objects which actually signify Hindu conce

pts and attributes of certain Hindu deities. From the Vaastu point of view, symbols attributing to gods and goddesses and to the cosmic world are used to create a positive energy within the premises in an attempt to reinforce positive thoughts, deeds and actions. Let us discuss some of the most common symbols, used most widely and extensively, and the importance that they carry.
GANESHA
Lord Ganesha, epitomized as the ‘Vighnaharta’-remover of all obstacles and ‘Mangalkarta’- the doer of all good deeds, is believed to be the lord of lords in Hindu pantheon. Every household worships this divine power and even places its idols at the entrance of their house.  However, there are certain facts about Lord Ganesha which we all should be aware of. He has been entitled as the ‘God of Luck’ and should be revered at the beginning of any auspicious ceremony sas to secure the blessings of the deity and make the Puja prosperous and fruitful. He travels a rat, carries a noose to trap the illusionary powers, portrays the’ Vara mudra’ with one hand to grant blessings to his devotees, and the ‘abhaya mudra with another hand to remove all fears. Lord Ganesha reflects poverty on his back and hence, while placing an idol of the deity, it should be noted that his back is always facing the exterior portion of the house. Goddess Lakshmi occupies the place on his right to grant wealth and stability t

o the worshippers. Laddoo or Modak is his favorite food and should be offered to him in the form of Prasad. Tulsi leaves should never be offered to Lord Ganesha. 
SWASTIK
Swastika is a signifier of peaceful energy penetrating from all the four directions viz. north, south, east and west. It indicates that we can bring in prosperity from all corners by balancing all the nine directions. In South India and Gujarat, the swastika symbol is drawn on the main entrance of every home. The vertical lies of a swastika show the creation of the universe while the horizontal line indicates its expansion. This symbol is an identity of Lord Ganesha and to show his presence, two vertical lines are drawn on either side to depict his two wives, Riddhi and Siddhi. A swastika symbol with two vertical lines, as mentioned above, should be drawn on the main door of the house. In case of commercial buildings, the words ‘shubh’ and ‘laabh’ should also be written on either side.
AUM
We are all aware of this most common and highly illustrious symbol called’ Aum.’ It has over hundred meanings and is an indicator of prosperity, stability and well-being for every household. Regarded to be the sound of the Almighty, the reflection of Aum kills all negativities including feelings of anger, hatred, jealousy, fear and ego. It is not always possible to keep an image of our deities everywhere, instead, in suc

h places; drawing a symbol of Aum would suffice and make up for this shortage and ignite positivity within the surrounding.
KALASH (Pitcher) AND NARIYAL (Coconut)
The Kalash symbolizes all the three deities-Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva- as per Hindu mythology. Placing a coconut at the main entrance on a pitcher filled with water would bring in health, wealth and wisdom for the family. It should also be placed in the kitchen and mandir (place of worship) of the house as it is an indication of prosperity and the existence of Varundev, Lord of water, as well. If coconut filled water along with other gifts is given to close family and relatives, it becomes highly auspicious for the giver as well as the receiver. 
CHARAN (Footprints)
Various colors of rangoli are used to make the footprints of Goddess Lakshmi on the floor of the main entrance of the house, kitchen, mandir and the cash locker. This symbolizes her entrance and warm welcome into the premises.

The main entrance of a premise exhibits and influences the Vaastu of that place profoundly. It is the gateway for the entry of positive and negative vibrations into the house or building. Hence, great care should be taken while assigning the direction and placement of the main door of your dream house.
The main entrance of the house is not simply a door; it is a reflection of the personality, beauty and behavior of its occupants. It is considered to be the ‘face’ of any house which ultimately marks its impression on the visitor. It is, therefore, highly essential to keep this access into the house n the proper and most suitable direction as well as location.
NORTH
If the main door is placed in the North, it is considered very favorable for its owners. However, it should be located in the third, fourth and fifth part of the North direction. Also, the main gate should be visible while standing inside the building premises and looking out.


EAST
If the main gate is positioned in the third and fourth part of the East direction, it is believed to bring in prosperity for its inmates. 
WEST
West direction is not very suitable for the placement of the main entrance of a house. However, if there are no further options, one can place it in the fourth and fifth part of this direction.
SOUTH
Most of the scriptures and even Vaastu consultants regard this direction as inauspiciou

s and unlucky, but this is not totally true. The main entrance in the South, if placed in the third and fourth part, proves to be very beneficial for the owners.
NOTE: The main point to be noted here is all entry parts are counted from left to right, while facing the specified direction.
TAKING CARE OF THE MAIN DOOR
After ascertaining the correct direction for the placement of the main door, our responsibility is not over. Being the ‘face’ of every house, the main entrance has to be maintained and kept well on a regular basis, just like we take care of our face every day in an attempt to look attractive, beautiful and inspiring.
1. Every direction has its own share of positivities and negativities when talking about the placement of the main entrance for the house. If the main door is positioned here, in the South-west, it would lead to leaking of the above, thereby leading to creation of various problems and delays in every endeavor of your life.
2. The dimension of the main door should also abide by Vaastu rules and regulations. Ideally, the length and breadth of the main door should be in the ratio of 1:2 and should not be compromised on account of

shortage of space or low ceiling height as this hinders the free flow of energy relating to opportunities and wealth.
3. It is believed that Goddess Lakshmi resides at places which are absolutely clean, and spic and span. Only a beautifully maintained, clean, well kept main door would attract the deity to place her feet inside the building or premises. Hence, it should be noted that the main entry door is not worn out and is well kept at all times.
4. The main door should be adorned with auspicious symbols like the feet of Maa Lakshmi, a Kalash with a coconut on it, Swastik on either side of the wall, ‘Riddhi Siddhi’ and ‘Shubh-Laabh’ written on the wells on each side. These words represent Lord Ganesha as the former are names of his two wives and the latter are his two sons.
5.  The main door should be adorned with a Toran or a Bandarwaar as it brings in good luck and waives off evil or bad energies.
6. Evil forces and negative energies can be warded off by lighting an earthen Diya or lamp at the main entrance door everyday at sunset. This custom is considered to be very effective.
7. Make sure that all the doors of your house, including the main door, should be well-oiled and kept lubricated so as to avoid the creaking sound coming from them. These noises destroy the positive energy entering or already existing within the house.

house always opens inwards towards the left and not outwards on the right. This enables the positive energies to enter and flow freely within the premises.
9. There should not be any other door, within the building or outside, which happens to face the main door when opened.
10. A small ventilator present above the main door is considered very auspicious.
11. Presence of ‘Vedh Shools’ or sharp arrows of energy outside your building are not a good sign. For example; buildings situated at the T-end of a road, presence of a big tree or a pole, a big wall or a building in front of the main entrance is not good either. olk.

Mandir
A Mandir or a Puja room is a place where there is maximum positive energy stored for encrypting the entire house. It is a place where we devote ourselves to God Almighty and seek his blessings to face the challenges of life. Hence, this room should incorporate all the principles of Vaastu and add to our trust, devotion and dedication to God.
The North-east direction of a house or property is the most suitable place to position your Gods and Goddesses. It is known as ‘Ishann’ or the corner for God or ‘Ishwar.’ This is the point where earth’s magnetic energy is generated and hence is considered most ideal for placing a mandir. If, by any chance, there is no scope for keeping the Mandir in this direction, you should make sure that you face this direction while praying. 
1. The best materials for a Mandir are wood and marble.
2. The mandir should never be adjacent to a bathroom. It should also be kept in mind not to make a temple inside the kitchen or bedroom.
3. It is not at all advisable to build a mandir underneath the stairca

se or position a structure over it as it would lead you to stepping over it symbolically.

6. Too many pictures or symbols of a single God should be avoided.
7.  Every evening, a diya or incense stick should be lighted before the idols in your Mandir.
8. The photo or picture of a Guru or a deceased person should never be placed in the Mnadir along with the other Gods and Goddesses as they were human beings who are definitely lower in position as compared to God, Almighty.

It is believed that Goddess Lakshmi’s sister, named Daridrata (meaning poverty) occupies the place on the back of Lord Ganesha and hence you should never position this deity’s pictures with His back to the house. This would mean you are inviting poverty inside your house.

A Drawing room has always been regarded as the status symbol of its residents and a reflection of one’s power, prestige, personality and goodwill in society. It is used as a place to welcome all distinguished and formal guests and hence should be maintained beautifully. It marks the first impression of the inmates of the house for people coming to visit them. Just as the Maharaja’s of yester years used their court room to discuss agendas and meetings with their councilors, similarly in modern day homes; the drawing room is used as a public area of the house where guests and outsiders are entertained. Beyond this point, strangers are not allowed or permitted to peep into your private area.
Guests being entertained in the drawing room should feel comfortable and cozy and this can happen only if positive energy flows within this area. So, it is highly essential to harmonize this place as per Vaastu and its principles, apart from ensuring its beautification. Here are a few tips to suffice the needful.
1. The East, North or North-west directions are best suited for a drawing area within the house.
2. The Eastern side of this room should be kept free from furniture, light and airy as far as possible.
3. The southern and western walls should be used to place all the heavy furniture pieces.
4. The seating arrangement should be such that while occupying the seats, one should face t

he East direction.
5. It is advisable to hang a mirror on the Northern wall of the drawing room as it enhances the positive effects of the energies emerging from the north direction. Windows can also be installed on the northern and eastern walls as this would bring in prosperity for its occupants. 
6. The drawing room should be used to display all your expensive and priceless possessions like showpieces, art forms achievements, and so on. The logic behind this is that according to Vaastu, what you showcase comes back to you in a round circle and in multitudes.
7. Try using pastel green hue for the walls of your drawing room. Also, the area should be well lit up and bright.
8. Fresh flowers and plants are a good medium to decorate and beautify your drawing room, especially red and yellow flowers. This assists in creating a dynamic and prosperous environment. However, care should be taken to dispose of dead flowers immediately. Also avoid using artificial or dried flowers for enhancing its beauty and interiors.
9. Fragrances like room fresheners, aroma oils, incense and essential oils of flowers help create a positive environment by removing unwanted odor and clearing the house off negative energy forms. Good smell appeals to everyone, including angels and deities. Hence, these should be used to create a healthy and fresh environment around you.
10. A bowl full of sea-salt

should be kept around the room as this substance contains magical powers to extract negativity from the surroundings.
11. Quartz crystals can also be used to induce positive energy in the environment and free it from all negativities as it is blessed with amazing cleansing properties. 
12. A fountain with fresh running water or a bowl of flowers with fresh water in it can be placed in the north or the north-eastern walls as this brings in prosperity for its residents.
13. We should not use idols and images of Gods and Goddesses to decorate the drawing room.
14. One should avoid keeping dead objects like dried flowers, broken articles, skins of wild animals or antiques anywhere in the house, including the drawing area. These objects contain the negative energies of the user and hence prove to be inauspicious and unhealthy.
15. Southern, South-eastern and South-western directions should not be used to hang wall clocks, time pieces and calendars as they bring in an unfavorable phase in one’s life. They should not be placed above the doors as well.  Also make sure that all clocks hanging in your house and office premises are in working condition. If not, then wrap them in a box or paper and store them in a close wardrobe.

These days’ architectures design the dining room as an extension of the drawing room. A Dining room is a place where the family gets together at meal times, spends quality time with each other and even discusses their experiences of their hectic day. Hence, this place plays a vital role in building harmony, peace and love among the family members of a house. Vaastu lays down certain principles pertaining to the position and direction of the Dining room which would strengthen and build healthy and strong ties among the members of the residing family within the structure called their home. 
1. Make sure that the members of the family face the east, north, north-east or north-west directions while having their food.
2. The dining table should always be adorned with fresh fruits and flowers.
3. One should install a mirror on the eastern wall of the dining room which in turn would reflect the food lay out on the table. Doing this would bring in prosperity and health for the family members. 
4. Pickles should always be kept covered as they create sourness in relations. Similarly, sharp objects like knives and scissors should be kept covered at all times or else they give rise to unpleasantness in relations among the close family members, relative and friends.
5. An oval shaped dining table is considered inauspicious.
6. The dining table of the house should be kept in such a pos

ition that it is not visible from the main door. If the architectural lay out of the house does not permit this, one can use a screen or a curtain to form the partition.
7. The dining table should stand out and should not be over shadowed by the rest of the furniture kept in the room. 
8. A focus light suspending from the ceiling onto the dining table is considered very auspicious.
9. A dining table should never be kept against a wall; it should have enough moving space on all its sides.
10. The number of chairs with the dining table should always be even, i.e. two, four, six and so on. 
11. You should never display medicines as what you sow, so you reap.

The significance of a good kitchen can be understood by the fact that a woman, especially an Indian wife, spends most of her day in this part of the house, preparing delicious meals for the rest of the family. We gain energy from food and this food is prepared in the place called Kitchen. Hence it can be righteously said that the kitchen form the backbone of the house. A house without a kitchen is like a car without wheels.
In olden days, kitchens were situated in open spaces which would allow lots of light to penetrate from all directions and also permit easy escaping of smoke generated while cooking. But in the modern day world, due to scarcity of space, generally very small areas are allotted to kitchens. In such a scenario, it becomes almost mandatory to create a Vaastu-friendly kitchen which can take care of our emotional, physical and biological requirements completely.
1. The most ideal location for a kitchen is the south-east. Talking about other directions, where a kitchen in the north-east would bring in heavy losses for the family, the one situated in the south-west would lead to clashes among the family members. Nevertheless, there would be high rise in expenditures if a kitchen happens to be in the north-west of a plot.
2. Both natural as well as artificial lighting, in abundance, is a must for the kitchen area. There should also be proper ventilation with windo

ws on the eastern sides. 
3. The kitchen door should be in the north but care should be taken to assure that while cooking food, the cook’s back should not face the door.
4. The color palette for a kitchen should be in fiery shades of red, orange, brown yellow and so on. Blue, being the color of water, and black should not be used at all. However, a tinge of green can be used to rectify the wrong Vaastu placements.
5. The north-eastern corner should not be used to place the cooking stove. The ideal place for this is the eastern walls or the south-east corner as this direction is called the Agneya Disha, named after fire. The solar heat is at its maximum when the sun faces this direction and hence it is believed to be occupied by the Lord of Fire as per Hindu mythology. Also, the sun releases Vitamins D and F when it reaches the south-east direction which is highly beneficial for everyone. 
6. All heat-generating equipments like geysers, microwaves, hot cases and other electronic gadgets should be placed in the south-east direction of the kitchen.
7. The cook should either face the east or the south direction while cooking. Facing the north or the west direction is not favorable.
8. The element of water, as we all know, is anti-fire. However, it is also not possible to work in the kitchen in the absence of the former. Hence great care should be taken while positioning thes

e two anti-elements. Water arrangements should be restricted to the north or north-east. They should be placed to the left side of the gas stove. Wash basins, sinks and even drinking water should be on the left side while using the gas stove.
9. A refrigerator should not be placed inside the kitchen as the water and fire elements tend to clash in this case.
10. Heavy furniture, groceries and grains should all be stored in the southern and western sides of the kitchen, including the kitchen cabinets and closets.
11. The northern and eastern corners of the kitchen should always be kept clutter-free.
12. Pictures of Gods and Goddesses should never be kept in the kitchen. Keeping the Mandir here is a taboo as per Vaastu rules and regulations.
13. A kitchen should be the most hygienic and clean place of the house and must be kept spic and span at all times.

The bedroom is the most private, personal and secluded area of an individual where he tends to relax and rejuvenate after a hard day’s toil. On an average, a person spends one-third of his life in his bedroom. Hence, its location, placement of furniture, color palette used for the interiors etc. should all abide by Vaastu principles so as to create a positive and relaxing environment for him as well his spouse, in case of a married couple.
Vaastu analysts believe and approve that the direction in which one sleeps highly influences the working ability and compatibility with his partner and other family members as well. If the placement of the bedroom is not correct as per Vaastu, you would suffer from various health problems, insomnia or disturbed sleep, restlessness and regular quarrels with your better half. To assure peace and prosperity in life, one should therefore be very careful while choosing the bedroom for himself.
1. The south-west is the most suitable direction for a bedroom to be occupied by the head of the family. 
2. In case of a joint family, newlyweds should not occupy the south-west room as it would lead to friction between the bride and her in-laws. Alternatively, they should have their bedroom either in the southern or the western portion of the house.
3. A pregnant woman should never occupy the north-east corner bedroom as it would increase her chances o

f having a miscarriage.
4. Unmarried girls should stay in bedrooms located in the north-western part of the house. Couples occupying bedrooms in this section of the house may suffer from diseases like asthma, breathing disorders, cough and cold. 
5. As discussed before, the south-east portion of a house is allotted to the God of fire and hence couples should never have a bedroom in this part of the house as it would cause high blood pressure to the occupants, thereby leading to clashes in their marital status.
6.  The position of the bed in a bedroom plays a very important role in ascertaining peace and prosperity for the person using it. The bed should always be placed against a solid wall and not against one that has windows behind it. Care should also be taken to ensure that the bed should not point towards the bathroom wall or is adjoining to it as this would invites a lot of negative energy for the person sleeping on the bed thereby causing health problems for him.
7. The head should always be pointing to the south while sleeping and never to the north direction. People sleeping in the latter direction are eventually lying in the direction of the flow of the electromagnetic waves which travels from the north to the south. This would lead to headaches and body aches for them on getting up in the morning.
8. Pointing your feet towards the door of the bedroom while lying

on the bed is also considered inauspicious and creator of various health problems.
9. Couples should share a common bed, mattress and sheets as this would increase harmony and love in their relationship.
10. Pillow cases and bed sheets should be replaced with new ones every six months as they tend to absorb all the negativity that you shed on them while sleeping.
11. Dull or sharp colors should not be chosen for the walls of the bedroom. Colors like light green, light blue, a tinge of lilac or purple are the best color schemes for this area. A pure white is excellent for creating spiritual harmony within the surrounding atmosphere.
12. The North-east corner of the bedroom should be kept free from heavy furniture or any kind of clutter.
13.  Pictures of animals fighting, hunting lions, trees devoid of flowers and fruits and dead animals like pigeons, snakes, crows, owls and vultures should never be hung on the walls of the bedroom.
14. We should not hang pictures of Gods and Goddesses in the bedroom as this place is used by us for enjoying life in its different forms like drinking, sleeping relaxing and so on. Indulging in such activities in front of our idols is considered as disrespectful.
15. A mirror should not be placed in a bedroom. However, if it is inevitable, then the position of the mirror should be such that it does not reflect your image while sleeping on bed

.
16. It is a very common practice to store objects under the bed due to scarcity of space or otherwise. However, this influences your sleep pattern majorly. If we talk about the principle of proximity, things placed around us have a very strong influence on us. Storing shoes under the bed would keep you ‘running around’ all night even while in sound sleep. If you stuff clothes under the bed, they would not let you have a restful sleep as they carry various life experiences attached with them. Similarly, keeping work-related papers under the bed would stimulate your intellectuality, thereby not letting you switch to rest mode. Also, knives, utensils and other junk items create strained relationships and confusions and hence should be avoided at all costs.
17. A television in the bedroom emits electromagnetic radiation which is very harmful for its occupants and therefore you should not have one in your sleeping area.
18. Cash lockers should not be installed in the bedroom. On the contrary, a safe can be placed but only in the south-west corner which opens facing the northern or eastern directions.
19. Aquariums, water fountains and other water elements should never be placed in a bedroom as they bring about instability in life.
20. A window on the eastern wall is highly favorable as it receives positive energies from the ultraviolet rays of the rising sun. it even helps em

it the negative vibrations present within the room.
21. There should not be a beam in your bedroom as this may cause serious health problems and unnecessary tensions. If, in case, there is one which cannot be avoided, make sure you do not sleep under it at any cost.

A bathroom is a place where we shed away and get rid of all our negative energies and hence it is considered to be one of the most sensitive zones as per Vaastu doctrines. In olden times, bathrooms used to be located outside the house. Then came the league when they used to be built away from the bedroom, but in today’s age, a bathroom forms one of the most essential parts of a bedroom and are therefore comes attached with it. So, it becomes all the more important to maintain perfect hygiene and cleanliness within its confines both in terms of physical as well as Vaastu scriptures.
Great care should be taken to choose the location, placement and positioning of the bathroom in every room or else it can create havoc in the lives of its users and the inmates of the house.
1. The north-west is the best direction for locating the bathroom in any room. This being an air-element direction does not hamper the flow of subtle energies.
2. As mentioned before, the north-east is a very pious direction, owned by Lord Shiva and occupied by the forehead of the Vaastu Purush. Constructing a bathroom in this direction is considered to be a crime as per Vaastu principles which can lead to disastrous health issues, accidents and uninvited tensions for its inmates.
3. The fire element occupies the south-east and hence a bathroom should not be made in this direction either. A bathroom forms par

t of the water element and fire and water being in opposition to each other can lead to unexpected losses, legal issues, electricity-related mishaps, accidents and so on.
4. The south west should, again, not be used for creating a bathroom as the magnetic energy coming from the north-east gets stored in this direction. Placing a bathroom here would mean draining out all of this, thereby causing feelings of depression and anxiety for its owners.
5. The center of the house is occupied by Lord Brahma and hence this place should also be kept devoid of a bathroom. Also, the gravitational energy emanates from the center of a structure and a bathroom here would destroy and infect this positive energy.
6. While entering a premises or building, the bathroom should not be visible from outside.
7. The bathroom releases a lot of negative energy and therefore it should never be positioned next to the kitchen or the Mandir of the house.
8. The water closet (commode) should be positioned in a manner so that while using it one does not face the sun. The ideal directions for the same would be the North, north-west or west.
9. The taps and shower equipments should be placed on the northern walls as this direction has a water element and facing the north while using them attracts financial prosperity for the users.
10. There should not be storage spaces in the bathroom. Also, they should b
e kept uncluttered and pristine, not necessarily decorated.

topic: VAASTU FOR CHILDREN’S ROOM AND STUDY
text:
We all have very high hopes from our children and always want to give them the best. They are not only the future of our country but also the apple of their parents’ eyes. The best gift for them would be to create a tension-free and non-stressful environment where they can breathe and work in peace and solace and handle the growing pressures of the competitive world around them. This can be made true by bestowing them with a Vaastu-perfect life.
To ensure a secure future for your children, it is very important to make their present surrounding harmonious and positive so that they can grow overall towards achieving their respective goals in life meritoriously. Here are a few do’s and don’ts which can alter their lives for a better tomorrow.
1. Children should never be given the south-western room of the house. This is the place for the head of the family and placing the children here would mean empowering them to dominate their elders and other family members.
2.  Children should never be given the corner rooms of any direction. The best and most suitable positions for them are the western or the southern sides of the plot.
3. The East, North and the North-east create greater absorption power and help increase the knowledge of the little ones. Hence, the study room for your children should always be in one of these positions.
4. While studying, kids should face the East or

the North as this will boost up their learning speed, improve memory and enhance their concentration power.
5.  Books should never be kept in the north-east direction; instead they should be stored in the south-west, south or western sides.
6. Books should be kept in closed areas or shelves with glass panel doors, open book shelves are not advisable as they create too much of congestion in the mind of the students.
7. The study table should not be cluttered with books as it tends to create unnecessary pressure on the minds of the children. 
8. There should be images of Lord Ganesha and Maa Saraswati in the study room.
9. Kids, while resting their heads on the pillow at night, should lie in the south direction. This would help maintain the magnetic balance of the body with that of the earth.
10. The study table should not rest against a wall. While sitting and studying, the child should have a solid wall behind his back.
11. The study table and the chair should not face the door when the child is studying.
12. The study area should be well lit up and spread over all corners. However, avoid placing a focus light or spot light on the child or the table as this would heighten the mental pressure and strain for him.
13. You can place a quartz crystal rock in the south-west corner of the study room. This stone has healing properties and can energize the environment in the ro

om with positive vibrations by sucking up all the negativities present there. 
14. To increase the concentration of the child, you can place an Amethyst crystal on the study table.

topic: OTHER ROOMS- GUEST ROOM, SERVANT’S ROOM & GENERATOR ROOM
text:
It is very commonly seen that people do not give much weight to the importance of location of extra rooms like guest room, generator room or the servant’s room in their house. The point to be noted here is that every area of your house, no matter who it is allotted to, plays quite an influencing role in determining your well being and success in life. There is a scientific and logical reasoning behind the positioning of every room as every section of the premises emits positive as well as negative vibrations which have to be balanced harmoniously so as to make your life happy and worth living.
GUEST ROOM        
‘Atithi devo bhava,’ meaning a guest is a representative of God himself according to Hindu culture and belief. Hence, great care should be taken regarding the comfort and well being of the guest coming to the house. However, it should be kept in mind that the placement of the guest room should be such that the host, too, benefits from him and that his presence does not create any kind of uneasiness in the latter’s daily regime and the guest returns to his destination with sweet memories of a happy and memorable stay with you and your family after a short span of time.
1. No one wants a guest to stay for long or become a permanent member of the house, and therefore the best location for a guest room is the north-west. This direction represents the Air element which is

text:
a symbol of instability and hence would drive away the guest in a few days.
2. The guest room should never be located in the south-west; this can lead to serious disasters.
3. South-east and north-east are also not suitable for positioning a guest room.
4. The guest room should have more openings towards the north and the east wall.
5. The bed should be aligned to the southern wall of the guest room.
6. White, shades of violet, grey or light blue should be used to paint the walls of this room.
7. The guest room should not be used to store belongings and articles used by the host.
8. The kitchen and the master bedroom should not be visible from the guest room.
SERVANT’S ROOM
We all need domestic help to run the household smoothly and peacefully, thanks to the increasing trend of nuclear families in our modern society. This calls for importance assigned to the servant’s room where the latter rests and restores his energy. Vaastu, like all other things, lays down certain principles regarding the location of the servant’s room as well. Let’s check them out.
1. The West is considered to be a neutral direction, neither strong nor weak, and hence it is best suited for the placement of the servant’s quarter. The north and the east, on the contrary, are very pious directions and therefore cannot accommodate a servant. As for the south and south-west, these are very powerful a

nd strong directions. Placing a servant’s room here would mean sharing your earth luck with him, which, ultimately would lead to making him dominant and stubborn. 
2. The North-west, as discussed before, is an unstable direction and hence a servant should never be made to occupy this area of the house. If positioned here, servants would keep coming and going every now and then, not enabling a healthy and long-term association with the employer.
3. If the North-west of your house has a garage, this can, however, be converted into a servant’s room.
4. Servants should not be allowed to sleep in the kitchen.
5. Make sure that the servant is not given a room right above your bedroom. This will make him a partner to your luck thereby making him get an upper hand in the employer-employee relationship. 
GENERATOR ROOM
Power cuts have become a regular affair in urban cities, making room for generators and inverters and including them as an inevitable part of our comfort and necessity in everyday living. As we all know, generators emit a lot of negative energy in the form of noise, heat, smoke and pollution. Hence, intent care should be taken while placing the generator so as to make sure that these bad energies do not affect the smooth running of our daily lives.
1. The South-east direction represents the Fire element and therefore this is the best location for a generator room.
