If, for any reason, this is not possible, then the second best option is the south portion of the house.
2. The smoke being emitted out of the generator should be vented out towards the south or the south-east. 
3. Dark colors and shades of red should be used to color the generator room as these hues tend to absorb the harsh negative energies being generated here.
4. If the south-west of the plot is used to occupy the generator; it can lead to spoiling the goodwill and reputation of the owner. The reason being, ala the positive energies provided by the north-east which was accumulated in the south-west would get burnt due to the emission of loud noise, heat and pollution from the generator. 
5. There should be an elevated platform below the generator as this would provide a smooth flow to the Earth’s gravitational energies.

Be it a professional, an entrepreneur or a businessman, the workplace of an individual makes a hell of a difference in determining his success and credibility in life. This includes the shape, placement as well as positioning of the work table, in synchronization with other related factors like lighting, pictures and credentials too. The need and demand for independent office premises is ever increasing and has become an inevitable and indispensible part of our modern day living. However, to make your career successful and sky-rocketing, one should not overlook the Vaastu aspects in relation to it.
SHAPE
The shape and structure of your office speaks a lot about your power and position as it influences your success rate drastically. Hence it must ensure elemental harmony. This can be perfected by making sure that the cabin where you sit is regular in shape and is well defines, without having any extensions or cut outs in it. A perfect square or a rectangle would make for an ideal choice.
PLACEMENT
1. Make sure that the location of your office is not in a deserted and lonely area; in fact it should be set amidst the hustle bustle of a moving crowd surrounded by running roads and lots of traffic. This would ensure prosperity and god luck for your business.
2. The North, North-east and North-west are considered to be very auspicious directions which attract good luck and posit

ive energies. One should choose an office building that faces one of these directions.
3. Set your sitting position against a solid wall. Having a door directly ahead of you or right behind your table invites betrayal. Beware of beams as well. They cause unnecessary stress. Hidden beams behind false ceilings are equally dangerous and should be avoided from beforehand.
4. The electronic equipments like computers, fax machines and so on should be kept on the left hand side of the table if your workstation faces the North. Alternatively, it should be kept on your right hand side if the direction that you face while sitting happens to be the East.
5. Always choose a corner towards the South or the West wall for sitting. Make sure the area on your left has a solid wall or is a closed one.
6. For businessmen, especially in the trading business, it is advisable to face the North or the East while working as this direction is owned by the Lord of wealth, Kuber. However, a professional or a person belonging to the service industry should face the East while working as this is the direction from where the sun rises and grows. 
WORK TABLE
1. The shape of your work able should be a regular one like a square or a rectangle. Abstract shapes are not considered auspicious. The idea is to have four corners and the dimensions should not exceed in the ratio of 1:2. If the length of the tabl

e measures more than the aforementioned ratio, it gives rise to confusion and delays.
2. Pictures of Gods and idols should not be placed on the desk. They should be assigned a proper and separate place with respect and honor.  
3. While working on your table, keep the left side heavier.
4. Eating on the workstation or table should be avoided at all means. Any activity which is not work-related should not be executed on the work table.
5. Reading magazines or sleeping on the work table generates negative energy and should not be encouraged. The workstation should be used solely for money making activities. Putting down your head on your desk for a power nap is also a taboo as per Vaastu principles.
6. The table where you work should be kept clean and uncluttered at all times. Cleanliness is next to Godliness and if you really want Goddess Lakshmi to shower her blessings on you, make sure you keep your work area absolutely spic and span. Again, clutter is synonymous to confusion. It also leads to creating disharmony among colleagues and should not be encouraged.
LIGHTING, PICTURES AND CREDENTIALS
1. Bright, white lightning is a must for people belonging to the marketing and trading sector. Professionals like doctors, architects and designers can have dim light sources in their work place but there should be adequate and sufficient lighting in the entire area.
2. Hang pict

ures of water cascades without mountains on the Northern wall. This brings prosperity and success for the business.
3. All your certificates, credentials and achievements should be placed on the western walls. You can even paste photos of successful and eminent heroes and business tycoons relevant to your trade. They prove to be quite beneficial.
VAASTU FOR OFFICE
While doing up the interior designing of an office, it is highly essential to keep in mind certain Vaastu principles which are mandatory to keep your working capability intact and also enhance and build a positive atmosphere within the office premises.  These Vaastu guidelines have n=been mentioned underneath.
1. Automatically operating doors are not advisable for commercial establishments. Care should be taken to paint the doors of the office well so as to avoid irritating noises while opening or closing them. These kill the positive energies present in and around the surroundings.
2. Dustbins should never be kept next to the doors. Also, keep all dustbins concealed and closed.
3. The main door of your office should not face another door as this would let all the good energies to flow out. The best way to conserve energy and to make it reach every nook and corner is by placing the doors in a zigzag pattern.
4. Mirrors or mirror-like objects should not be placed in front of the main door as they tend to reflect

and repel positive energy.
5. The reception counter should be positioned in the north direction. Its height should be a standard one and it should not have a reflective glass top. Moreover, it should not have the business logo embossed on it. Placing a water body, like an aquarium or a fountain, in the reception area is considered to very auspicious but make sure the flow of water should not be pointing towards the main door. 
6. The nature of the business of the organization should be reflected through the office reception. The company profile or logo should be pasted on the southern wall and placement of the reception table should be diagonal to the main door. This area should be decorated with fresh flowers to ensure flow of positive energy in its premises.
7. The guest seating arrangement must be along the western wall.
8. The northern wall should be kept light in weight, must be painted in light pastel shades and must have maximum openings in the form of windows. All closets, cupboards and storage almirahs should be rested against the southern walls. 
9. Storage of files should be done depending on their importance, priority and what they contain. General files should be stored on the western walls, files relating to legal issues must be kept in the north-eastern 
10. The marketing staff should be allotted the north-west direction. This area belongs to the air eleme

nt and hence instigates the sales personnel to get on to the field and work laboriously. 
11. The east direction should be allotted to the accounts and administration staff as this position is good for manipulating fund movement.
12. The cash lockers and safes should be placed in the south west corner of the office to ensure stability of assets.
13. The head of the office should occupy the south west area as it is the strongest position which would enable him to manage and control the entire infrastructure with great efficiency.
14. None of the employees should sit with their back against a window as this is considered very inauspicious.
15. The eastern and northern walls should not have the bathrooms placed along them or else it would bring in financial instability, payment problems and low business turnover for the owner.

topic: VAASTU TIPS FOR BOSSES AND BUSINESS
text:
In the present competitive business scenario, we all are running a rat’s race to excel in our respective field of work. Be it a professional or a businessman, we all have our set of inhibitions and fears in respect to business related success and accomplishments. Politics at the office front, competition among employees and subordinates, unhealthy work environment, all these are a part and parcel of handling daily business pressures which one has to face in life some time or the other. Eminent Vaastu scholars believe that abiding by Vaastu principles can solve these issues very smoothly and even stop their creation, thereby building harmonious relations among the employers as well as the employees. 
Simple Vaastu tips for avoiding tensions and creating a healthy work environment at the office front.

As the owner of the business, make sure that the north-west corner of your workplace is not over-burdened or elevated as compared to the south-east corner. A high rising apartment or building catches the attention of one and all. However, not just beauty-wise but the elevation and height of a building has far greater impact on its residents and is hence discussed extensively in Vaastu doctrines. Even the staircase plays a considerable role in determining the heights of success in an individual’s life. It is believed that energies filled with the forces of life ascend with the stairs of a building and get distributed into its internal structure. 
When we talk about the height of a structure, in terms of Vaastu, we actually refer to the correct proportion in which it should be elevated. The location and shape of the stairs, too, play a vital role in determining the flow of positive energy within its premises. Hence, it becomes almost mandatory to plan out the correct positioning and proportion of your building’s appropriate height, elevation as well as the stairs at the time of construction.
HEIGHT AND ELEVATION IN VAASTU
Characterization of buildings, depending on their respective heights, has been done in Vaastu science. Let’s have a look at some key points relating to this.
1. If the height of a building is equal to its width, it is considered to have medium Vaastu qualities, meaning neither too good nor too bad.
2. If the height of a structure is more than its width by a quarter, then it is believed to possess good Vaastu w

hich would bring in peace in the lives of its inmates.
3. A building’s Vaastu is perfect if its height is one and a half times more than its width. Such structures bring prosperity and success for its owners.
4. If the height of a building is three fourth more than its width, it is supposed to have excellent Vaastu.
5. The Vaastu of a structure is extraordinarily good if its height is just the double of its width. Such buildings bring in overall health, wealth, prosperity and success for its occupants.
Some more points to be noted to ensure good Vaastu for your structure in terms of its elevation are as follows:
1. If a building is south-facing, its elevation should be very heavy and it should have lesser openings in terms of windows and doors. Also, in such cases, the construction should be done in its front portion.
2. In case of North-facing structures, their elevation should be very light and they should possess as many openings as possible in the form of windows and doors to let the magnetic energy coming from the North Pole flow easily into the building premises.
3. For west –facing buildings, the construction rules are similar to the south-facing ones i.e. keeping them heavy and with minimum number of openings. To do this, one can make the pillars heavy, plant bushes, shrubs and trees choose darker shades for painting and so on so as to create a sense of heaviness

.
4. Again, the East-facing houses should be light and open in order to allow maximum amount of sunlight to enter the premises. This would ensure overall growth for its occupants and the ultra violet rays entering the structure from this direction would even cleanse the whole atmosphere off any negative energies present thereof. 
STAIRS IN VAASTU
There are certain Vaastu rules which have to be applied while constructing the stairs for a structure. They are as follows:
1. The south, south-west and the north-west are considered the best locations for the construction of stairs within a premise. Stairs should never be built in the northern section of the plot.
2. The number of steps in a staircase should always sum up to an odd number like 5, 7, 9 and so on.
3. The staircase is where we place are feet at every level, hence we should avoid hanging pictures of Gods and Goddesses anywhere along this area. Also, this being the most unstable portion of the house, we should not hang pictures of family members and friends along the staircase as well.
4.   Beauty-wise it is a common trend these days to construct spiral staircases but in terms of Vaastu, such stairs are not considered auspicious as they tend to bind the structure with negative energy.
5. The stairs should always ascend in a clockwise direction. Anti-clockwise steps bring in bad energies, signifying the reverse move

ment of time frame for its residents.
6. If a door is made at the head of the staircase it is considered propitious.
7. The staircase should not be constructed in front of the main door of the house as this would let all the positive energies to automatically climd up to the next level, not letting it circulate in the lower area of the building or apartment.
8. There should not be bathroom or a seating arrangement under the stairs as this is very unlucky. A storage space can be built in this area.
9. The kitchen of a house should never be positioned under the staircase as this would stagnate the prosperity of the house.
10. The staircase is always burdened with weight crossing it every now and then; hence you should avoid constructing your meditation room or mandir under it.

We all know that the earth consists of gravitational and magnetic forces which in turn are an integral part of Vaastu philosophy. Pertaining to this context, the levels and slopes of a building play a very important role in determining the kind of energy, positive or negative, that would float within it. nds of problems relating to health, wealth and goodwill.

Among the five elements of nature, water in the most potent one on which depends our very life and existence. ‘No water, No life.’ Water is precious and despite great innovations and discoveries in almost every sphere of life, scientists all across the globe are yet to find a substitute for this naturally available and highly essential element of life.
From the Vaastu point of view, water, in whatever forms it is used by man, should be directed, stored, and placed in the correct direction so as to ensure stability, growth and abundance in his life. This includes storage water tanks, overhead and underground tanks and septic tanks too. Incorrect placement of any of these can cause lots of difficulties and disrupt one’s day to day living extensively.
UNDERGROUND WATER TANKS
Water scarcity has become a normal thing with the growing population, giving rise to the growing demand for underground water tanks, especially in small colonies and multi-storied apartments. However, Vaastu lays down certain principles for the placement of the same which should be kept in mind to ensure their correct location. 
1. Underground water tanks should never occupy the south-west area of a given plot or else it would invite serious problems like depression, anxiety etc. for the occupants of the building constructed on it. 
2. Location of underground water tanks in the south-west would also exhau

st all your earned income as well as savings. 
3. Underground water tanks placed in the south-east would cause fire-related accidents or other related problems. This includes clashes among the family members, bad reputation among relatives and friends and unwanted fights.
4. Another major problem which can be caused due to wrong placement of underground water tanks is occurrence of thefts, taxation issues and legal tangles.
OVERHEAD WATER TANKS
Overhead water tanks are installed to provide water instantly into bathrooms and washrooms. The best location for these is the south-west portion of the house which would provide the inmates’ confidence to execute and complete their pending projects well within time. 
1. If overhead water tanks are positioned in the north east part of the building, they lead to serious Vaastu defects which directly invite mental and health issues for its occupants.
2. As in the case of underground water tanks, if overhead water tanks are also placed in the south east portion of the house, it would create the same kinds of problems related to fire.
3. The family would be burdened with financial crisis if overhead water tanks are placed over the kitchen.
4. If overhead water tanks are placed above the bedroom, its residents would have sleepless nights, unnecessary tensions and health problems.
5. The only place for keeping the overhead water tanks

is above the bathrooms.
SEPTIC TANK
Despite modernization in every part of the globe, there are many such places in the outskirts of urban cities, in industrial units in remote areas and in farmhouses where the sewerage line does not extend. Hence, huge pits and tanks are erected to dump all kinds of industrial and human wastes. Such tanks are called septic tanks. Vaastu guidelines mention the positioning of these as well.
1. Septic tanks should always be round in shape.
2. The position of the tank should never be south west as this would cause depression and delays for the inmates.
3. Chances of severe accidents and diseases are generated if the septic tank is constructed in the north-east of the plot.
4. If the septic tank falls in the south-east, it would cause fire-related mishaps.
5. The best location for disposal of waste is north-west and hence a septic tank should only be built in this direction.
OIL TANKS
Oil tanks are a necessity for certain types of industries which is used to conserve and store oil. Let’s see where these should be placed so as to prove fruitful for the proprietor of the business.
1. Under no circumstances should the oil tanks be placed in the north-eastern region of the factory premises.
2. They should not occupy the south-west either.
3. The best location for oil tanks is the eastern side and moving towards the southern direction.

COLORS
Colors are nothing but vibrations of light at different wavelengths which cause the creation of its various different shades and hues. Colors immensely dominate many aspects of our life including emotional, physical, intellectual, materialistic as well as intuitive, thereby affecting our behavioral patterns, moods and even lifestyle. Vaastu says that these colors have to be tuned well within our respective environments so as to create a harmony with them. In olden days, learned people were well versed with the influence of the seven primary colors on their lives and hence associated them with the corresponding seven planets and the seven days of the week in correlation with the seven major chakras or energy centers present in the human body.
With the growing consciousness of Vaastu and its effects on mankind, it has become almost inevitable to synchronize well with the seven primary as well as the secondary color shades so that they work together to ensure successful living for one and all. To execute this, it is highly important to be aware of the prosperities of all the seven primary colors viz. red, orange, yellow, green, blue, indigo and violet.
RED
Red is a color very closely linked with the human body. In fact, the blood which floats inside our system is red in color too. Red, being associated with the base chakra of the human body, symbolizes lust, passion and

materialism and also fire. The positivity with this color is it provides energy, will power and zeal to carry out activities.
1. The front portion of buildings facing the south should have red color painted on them. One can, alternatively, add a red color element to the front exterior if he is not very keen on getting the entire structure painted in red. For the interiors, the south wall of the living room can be colored in red to create life-force energy.
2. Pink or rosy red symbolizes love and is best suited for bedrooms, especially for newly-weds. In fact, it can be used by all married couples to avoid fights and conflicts with their spouses.
3. Avoid using dark red shades for the bedroom as they signify anger.
ORANGE
Orange is a color that stands for health, vitality, ambition, pride and communication. Proper use of it can make your life both prosperous and successful.
1. Young aspirant achievers should use orange color to paint the southern wall of their bedroom.
2. People who tend to get annoyed very quickly and are short tempered by nature should avoid the use of orange as it is a fiery color.
3. Kitchens located in the south or south-east can be colored in shades of orange.
4. Depressed souls or people who feel low often, should use this color more frequently as orange is a significant of life as well. Orange color in the puja room is also considered very ausp

icious.
5. Orange represents the Sacral Chakra in the human body which in turn is associates with the excretory system, genitals, pancreas, bladder and kidneys. People facing health problems with these organs should switch to the use of orange color in their lives.  
YELLOW
Yellow is the color which finds connectivity with Goddess Lakshmi and Goddess Saraswati. Where the literal connection of the color lies with light and illumination, its deeper connectivity enhances concentration, stabilization of the mind, intellect and higher mental activities of an individual. This color is best adorned on the northern walls of a structure.
1. North facing structures should be painted in orange on the front side as an invitation to Goddess Lakshmi. Also, the northern section rooms in the house should have this color predominantly.
2. People facing with broken limbs, fractures and weak bone density should wear orange color clothes as this color is known for its cementing and firming nature.
3. People who have mood swings very often and are stressed with behavioral problems should use this color more often as orange occupies the solar plexus chakra in the human body. 
4. Yellow is the color for prosperity and hence it is considered very lucky to keep yellow colored semi-precious and precious stones in the cash box at the work front.
GREEN
Green color is a symbol which stands for nat

ure, fertility, prosperity, abundance and growth. It induces positive vibrations which in turn generate rebirth and create new ideas. This color is blessed with a healing touch and a cooling effect and should be used by people who possess a stubborn and irritable nature.   
1. Green color is connected with the heart chakra and can be used by people suffering from heart and blood pressure problems. It even has a soothing effect and can be applied in bedrooms by couples facing disturbance in their married lives. Pastel green shades in the south-eastern bedrooms are very effective in this case.
2. East facing structures should be painted in green for the front façade as this helps bring in harmony and peace. Also, there should be a green element in the office of architects, designers, fashion stylists and others belonging to the consultancy business spectrum.




BLUE
Water and sky both are naturally adorned in blue. Hence, this color is a symbol of emotions, purity, inspiration, devotion and truth. Blue is a healing and merciful color which occupies the throat chakra and even assists in reducing pains and aches in the body.
1. Blue is an unstable and reducing color, therefore it should never be used in workplaces or restaurants, shops and offices. Being an element of water, it should not be used in the kitchen as well. Blue color is best suited for children’s bedroom

3. South-east is owned by fire and hence blue color is a taboo for this direction.
INDIGO
Indigo is blessed with abilities like curing of psychic behaviors, creating a spiritual environment and connecting to one’s inner self. 
1. This color is an ideal choice for the meditation and study room. However, it can be used anywhere leaving out the bathrooms and the kitchen.
2. A tinge of white, when added to indigo, creates a positive environment.
3. Indigo signifies and represents Lord Krishna and is therefore considered very auspicious.

VIOLET
Violet is a color which indicates and supports religious devotion, spirituality, knowledge and temperance. It enhances memory power, spiritual behavior, improves concentration and provides stability of mind.
1. This color is most appropriate for the puja room or the study room and is ideal for scholars, students or anyone who has lots of mental activity to perform.
2. This color is an absolute no-no for bathrooms and kitchens.
3. Violet should be restricted in places which are filled with ambitious and materialistic approach like offices

and workplaces as it induces a felling of spirituality within the inmates of that enclosure, thereby deviating them from their goal in life.
4. Violet brings about contentment and satisfaction in life. Hence, people who are always dissatisfied with what they have and are indecisive in their decisions should make usage of this color more often.

TIPS RELATED TO THE SPIRITUAL WORLD
APPLYING TILAK
Almost all Hindus wear a tilak on their forehead as it invokes a sense of purity and stability in them. Similar is the case with office buildings and residential houses. A tilak is applied right on the central wall of the building at a height of 6 to 8 feet from the ground level. Th

is is believed to augur prosperity for its residents. A tilak is even applied on all the doors of the house, leaving out the bathrooms.
However, the color of the tilak should be chosen depending on the requirement of the inmates of the building. People looking for peace and sanctity within their homes should apply a white sandal tilak and those seeking ambition, vigor and aggressiveness should go in for a red kumkum powder tilak. A yellow tilak should be chosen to attract wealth and financial success and for gaining a commanding effect and authority, one should make use of a bhasma tilak. To make the tilak work more positively, it should be applied in the form of symbols like Swastik or Aum. Many people use a U-shape for a tilak, this symbolizes the feet of Lord Vishnu who is the Preserver of the Hindu Trinity. A very general practice is to add rice grains to the tilak. This, however, is done to attract prosperity and satisfy Maa Annapurna who in turn fulfills the house and its inmates with fulfillment of food and various luxuries of life.
DEMON FACES
It is a very common belief that hanging pictures or masks of demons outside the building would ward off evils and negativities from entering into a premises. This, however, is not true. In fact, Vaastu considers this as a highly inauspicious act as prosperity and good luck find place only in places which exhibit beautiful and p

ious things. The best is to draw holy symbols on the building structure, as discussed above.
Many people even place pictures of deities outside their homes. This, again, is considered an offence in Vaastu because it is like showing disrespect to our Gods and Goddesses by leaving them alone, unattended in the harsh weather conditions of heat, rain, cold and storm, while we sit inside relaxed in the cozy confines of our drawing rooms.
SPIRITUALITY
Thanking the Almighty for all his blessings and support should be an inevitable part of our daily regime. Hence, we can make the environment spiritually effective and healthy by making use of violet shades. We should also sit quietly for some time and press our thumb against the index finger to concentrate on our karma. 
TIPS RELATED OT THE PHYSICAL WORLD
BODY POSTURES
Body postures depict and speak a lot about a person’s nature and personality. Also, certain postures are not permissible and are considered unreceptive in nature like sitting with legs crossed or crossing arms across the chest depict stubbornness in a person’s nature. Moreover, these postures restrict the free flow of energy from the base of the spine to the rest of the body. Hence, a person should always adopt an open posture with legs and arms in a straight position.
HEALTH
Health is wealth; a healthy mind and body can alone lead to prosperity and success. Speci

al care should be taken to keep health problems at bay. Never build a bathroom in the north-east as this welcomes chronic diseases for its inmates. The head should never be placed in the north while sleeping as the magnetic energy flow coming from the North Pole would disturb your sleep. Toilets, swimming pools and underground water tanks in the south also affect health seriously. Moreover, high blood pressure and irritability may be caused as a result of a bedroom placed in the south-east. Eye-related problems strokes and paralysis are caused if the eastern side of your plot is blocked.




FIRE
Fire is a sacred element of nature and should never be touched by feet including matchsticks and cigarette stubs. Many people have the habit of opening doors by pushing with their feet. This is considered highly inauspicious. Even rubbing your feet against each other or sleeping with crossed legs brings in bad luck. Remember, goddess Lakshmi blesses them who are neat, clean and odor free from top to bottom.
GOOD LIFE PARTNER
Opposites attract and the rule of relativity applies while choosing the correct life partner. It is said that the journey through life, even though the road is full with lots of pitfalls and holes, becomes easy and enjoyable if you have the right companion to accompany you throughout this journey called life. Usage of correct color combinations and sounds,

balancing darkness with light and dullness with sharp thought makes for a convenient and comfortable understanding between spouses.
RESTLESSS MOVEMENTS
It is very commonly seen in people to tap on tables or on their own body parts to produce sound or simply involve in unnecessary fidgety movements just for fun’s sake. These are not auspicious and should be avoided religiously.
DAILY BATH
One should start the day fresh by taking a bath early in the morning. This helps keep negative energies at bay. Taking a bath with sea-salt also boosts the flow of positive energy within the body.
STUDYING
Make sure your child has a solid wall behind his back while studying. This provides energy supports and improves concentration in the child. Also, see that the study area is free from clutter of old mails, letters, non-working pens, junk stationery items and so on as these bring in a lot of negativity with them.
DINING
It is believed that having your food in the kitchen, as people used to do in olden days, is very lucky and favorable for the members of the family. One should always face the north while eating. The first portion of every meal should be offered t the god of fire, the next pert to a cow and the third bit to a dog. This helps in clearing off the evil effects of any pre-earned bad actions. You can even donate food to organizations looking after stray dogs and street cows.

PARENT-CHILD RELATIONSHIP
Ego kills every relationship and delivers bad vibes within the environment and surrounding. This happens when the northern side of the plot is higher than the southern portion leading to an uncomfortable relationship with your siblings. Also, never let your son occupy the south-west room of the house, or else he would dominate you and even indulge in arguments and fights.
SECURITY FROM ENEMIES
No one wants enemies around them. This can be judged and taken care of by scanning the south-east of the building for main entrances and water sources and making them Vaastu-compliant.
TIPS RELATED TO THE MATERIAL WORLD
GOOD INCOME
You should never say that you are poor and cannot afford a good life. this will only lead to adding on to your problems. Pay your dues and balances on time. Face the north; this will open new money-making opportunities for you. Make sure the water slope in your plot or house does not face the south or south-west. The north to south passage should be clear to boost up the North Pole energy. Keep the entrance points of the house beautified and always step into the house from a prosperous direction. There should not be obstructions at the door either from outside or inside. Always place time clocks and calendars on the northern walls of your house.
LIGHTING
Darkness in a house or a building is an indicator of dullness, tension a

nd depression. One should switch on all the lights of the house in the evening for a short period of time, when the sun sets. This vanquishes the essence of darkness. Also, keep the light on in the north-east corner of the house at all times.
POSITIVE SOUNDS
Ringing bells in all corners of the house creates positive vibrations within the premises. This helps in removing negative elements present in the surrounding and even kills many kinds of bacteria from the sir. The sound of conch (shankh) is considered both auspicious as well as an eradicator of negativity from the house. Positive vibes are also created by playing soft and soothing music within the confines of your home.
NAME AND FAME
Name and fame bring along money but money alone cannot bring in name and fame for you. Keeping the East direction of the house neat and clean and free from any kind of burden ensures name, fame and goodwill for its residents.
HOUSE CLEANING TOOLS
House cleaning equipments like broom sticks and mops should not be placed under the staircase as it causes Vaastu imbalance. These things should not be kept in the north, north-east or east directions either. Also, brooms should not be kept in a standing position and one should never touch them with his feet as this is considered very inauspicious.
TIME AND DATE ARTICLES
Time-related objects like time pieces, wall clocks, calendars and other s

uch things should not be kept on the south. South-east or south-west walls or directions, this would induce an unfavorable time phase in one’s life. Clocks and calendars should not be placed above the doors as well. Make sure all time denoting machines are in working condition and operational. If any of them is not working, it should be wrapped in a piece of paper and kept in the cupboard.
MONEY
If, by any chance, there is a blockage of the flow of energies in your house, it would bring about stagnation in the flow of money in your life. Using multi-colored lights, ringing bells in all corners of the house, providing proper ventilation within the premises are all ways of improving this flow and letting the movement of money be smooth and rolling in your life. 
NAILS
Vaastu claims that even walls, although they are non-living objects, get hurt when hammered with nails on them to hang pictures and decorative items. Instead, you can use brass screws to do the needful.

The front courtyard or any of its adjoining walls in the house or at the office front should not be broken or in a dilapidated state. This area should be kept clutter-free as well. ouse are intact and in well maintained condition, just like the way we take care of our other belongings.

PETS AND PLANTS
Keeping pets and taking good care of them bring in positive energy and is considered very lucky as well. Keeping an aquarium and feeding fishes and birds is also regarded as very auspicious. It is believed that plants and animals, when share your food, tend to share your problems and sorrows and even heal your karma, thereby reducing your burden in multifold.

Vedic Vaastu suggests lighting an oil lamp outside the main door brings in light and good vibes within the house.
LAW OF ACCEPTANCE
The law of acceptance is the key to happiness. We should happily accept whatever comes our way. Not getting anxious during happy moments and staying calm at times of sorrow is the biggest parameter of a sensible and perfect human being. 




LIFE-FORCE ENERGIES
The universe around us is filled with life force subtle energies in the form

of magnetic energy, energy from the North Pole, gravitational energy and so on. To live in harmony and peace, we should make sure to tune in and welcome these energies into our house as far as possible by letting open their entry points and not blocking them in any manner. An obstacle-free flow of these positive forces would induce an element of life force within the environment thereby letting you grow in every respective field. These points should be noted at the time of constructing a building but if a structure has already been erected and there is no scope for bringing about physical changes, you can still induce positivity by playing soft music, keeping the area clutter-free, mopping the floor with sea salt and lighting incense sticks regularly.
PETS AND PLANTS
Both pets and plants share our joys and sorrows; are held responsible for our karma and absorb negativity present in and around us. Keeping fishes in an aquarium in the house, looking after pets, nurturing plants are simple ways of distributing our share of happiness and difficulties with them.

Human body is made up of all the five elements of nature viz Earth, space, fire, water and air. Where earth provides shape and size to the body, space produces sound, fire induces hunger, water supports fluids and air ignites a sense of touch. A healthy body is one which has all the five element well harmo

nized within it in the right condition and quantum. 
BODY VAASTU
Maintaining and following the right Vaastu rules not only balance the human body in accordance with the five elements, but also hold great importance in providing acceptance, prosperity, success and goodwill in life. Sitting in wrong positions with crossed arms and legs, not facing the north while working and not sleeping with the head in the right direction are some of the Vaastu defects which can make life troublesome and problematic for you and your family.
